row.Title: Access Control Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: AC-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] AC-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Account Management
row.Param_assigns: AC-2j [at least annually]

row.Title: Account Management | Automated System Account Management
Account Management | Removal of Temporary / Emergency Accounts
row.Param_assigns: [No more than 30 days for temporary and emergency account types]

row.Title: Account Management | Disable Inactive Accounts
row.Param_assigns: [90 days for user accounts]
row.Remarks: Requirement: The service provider defines the time period for non-user accounts (e.g., accounts associated with devices). The time periods are approved and accepted by the Authorizing Official.

row.Title: Account Management | Restrictions on Use of Shared Groups / Accounts
row.Remarks: Required if shared/group accounts are deployed

row.Title: Account Management | Shared / Group Account Credential Termination
row.Remarks: Required if shared/group accounts are deployed

row.Title: Account Management | Account Monitoring / Atypical Usage
row.Remarks: AC-2 (12)(a) and AC-2 (12)(b) Additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance: Required for privileged accounts.

row.Title: Information Flow Enforcement | Physical / Logical Separation of Information Flows
Least Privilege | Authorize Access to Security Functions
Least Privilege | Non-Privileged Access For No security Functions
row.Param_assigns: [all security functions]
row.Remarks: AC-6 (2). Guidance: Examples of security functions include but are not limited to: establishing system accounts, configuring access authorizations (i.e., permissions, privileges), setting events to be audited, and setting intrusion detection parameters, system programming, system and security administration, other privileged functions.

row.Title: Least Privilege | Auditing Use of Privileged Functions
Least Privilege | Prohibit Non-privileged Users from Executing Privileged Functions
Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
row.Param_assigns: AC-7a [not more than three] [fifteen minutes] AC-7b [locks the account/node for thirty minutes]

row.Title: System Use Notification
row.Param_assigns: Parameter: See Additional Requirements and Guidance.
row.Remarks: Requirement: The service provider shall determine elements of the cloud environment that require the System Use Notification control. The elements of the cloud environment that require System Use Notification are approved and accepted by the Authorizing Official (AO). Requirement: The service provider shall determine how System Use Notification is going to be verified and provide appropriate periodicity of the check. The System Use Notification verification and periodicity are approved and accepted by the AO. Guidance: If performed as part of a Configuration Baseline check, then the % of items requiring setting that are checked and that pass (or fail) check can be provided. Requirement: If not performed as part of a Configuration Baseline check, then there must be documented agreement on how to provide results of verification and the necessary periodicity of the verification by the service provider. The documented agreement on how to provide verification of the results are approved and accepted by the AO.

row.Title: Concurrent Session Control
row.Param_assigns: [three (3) sessions for privileged access and two (2) sessions for non-privileged access]

row.Title: Session Lock
row.Param_assigns: AC-11a. [fifteen minutes]

row.Title: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication
Remote Access | Protection of Confidentiality / Integrity Using Encryption
Remote Access | Managed Access Control Points
Remote Access | Disconnect / Disable Access
row.Param_assigns: [no greater than 15 minutes]

row.Title: Access Control For Mobile Devices | Full Device / Container-Based Encryption
Use of External Information Systems | Limits on Authorized Use
Use of External Information Systems | Portable Storage Devices
Publicly Accessible Content
row.Param_assigns: AC-22d. [at least quarterly]

row.Title: Security Awareness and Training Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: AT-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] AT-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Security Awareness Training
row.Param_assigns: AT-2. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] Parameter: [at least annually]

row.Title: Role-Based Security Training
row.Param_assigns: AT-3c. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] Parameter: [at least annually]

row.Title: Security Training Records
row.Param_assigns: AT-4b. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] Parameter: [At least one years]

row.Title: Audit and Accountability Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: AU-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] AU-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Audit Events
row.Param_assigns: AU-2a. [Successful and unsuccessful account logon events, account management events, object access, policy change, privilege functions, process tracking, and system events. For Web applications: all administrator activity, authentication checks, authorization checks, data deletions, data access, data changes, and permission changes]; AU-2d. [organization-defined subset of the auditable events defined in AU-2 a. to be audited continually for each identified event].

row.Title: Audit Events | Reviews and Updates
row.Param_assigns: AU-2 (3). [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] Parameter: [annually or whenever there is a change in the threat environment]
row.Remarks: Guidance: Annually or whenever changes in the threat environment are communicated to the service provider by the Authorizing Official.

row.Title: Content of Audit Records | Additional Audit Information
row.Param_assigns: AU-3 (1). [Assignment: organization-defined additional, more detailed information] Parameter: [session, connection, transaction, or activity duration; for client-server transactions, the number of bytes received and bytes sent; additional informational messages to diagnose or identify the event; characteristics that describe or identify the object or resource being acted upon]
row.Remarks: AU-3 (1). Requirement: The service provider defines audit record types. The audit record types are approved and accepted by the Authorizing Official. Guidance: For client-server transactions, the number of bytes sent and received gives bidirectional transfer information that can be helpful during an investigation or inquiry.

row.Title: Response to Audit Processing Failures
row.Param_assigns: AU-5b. [Assignment: Organization-defined actions to be taken] Parameter: [low-impact: overwrite oldest audit records; moderate-impact: shut down]

row.Title: Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting
row.Param_assigns: AU-6a. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] Parameter: [at least weekly]

row.Title: Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Process Integration
Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting | Correlate Audit Repositories
Audit Reduction and Report Generation | Automatic Processing
Time Stamps | Synchronization With Authoritative Time Source
row.Param_assigns: AU-8 (1). [http://tf.nist.gov/tf-cgi/servers.cgi] <At least hourly>
row.Remarks: AU-8 (1). Requirement: The service provider selects primary and secondary time servers used by the NIST Internet time service. The secondary server is selected from a different geographic region than the primary server. Requirement: The service provider synchronizes the system clocks of network computers that run operating systems other than Windows to the Windows Server Domain Controller emulator or to the same time source for that server. Guidance: Synchronization of system clocks improves the accuracy of log analysis.

row.Title: Protection of Audit Information | Audit Backup on Separate Physical Systems / Components
row.Param_assigns: AU-9 (2). [at least weekly]

row.Title: Protection of Audit Information | Access by Subset of Privileged Users
Audit Record Retention
row.Param_assigns: AU-11. [at least ninety days]
row.Remarks: AU-11. Requirement: The service provider retains audit records on-line for at least ninety days and further preserves audit records off-line for a period that is in accordance with NARA requirements.

row.Title: Audit Generation
row.Param_assigns: AU-12a. [all information system and network components where audit capability is deployed/available]

row.Title: Security Assessment and Authorization Policies and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: CA-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] CA-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Security Assessments
row.Param_assigns: CA-2b. [at least annually] CA-2d[individuals or roles to include FedRAMP PMO]

row.Title: Security Assessments | Independent Assessors
row.Param_assigns: Added to NIST Baseline for "Low" FedRAMP baseline.
row.Remarks: For JAB Authorization, must be an accredited 3PAO

row.Title: Security Assessments | Specialized Assessments
row.Param_assigns: [at least annually]
row.Remarks: Requirement: To include 'announced', 'vulnerability scanning'

row.Title: Security Assessments | External Organizations
row.Param_assigns: [Any FedRAMP Accredited 3PAO] [the conditions of a P-ATO in the FedRAMP Repository]

row.Title: System Interconnections
row.Param_assigns: CA-3c. 3 Years / Annually and on input from FedRAMP

row.Title: System Interconnections | Unclassified Non-National Security System Connections
row.Param_assigns: Boundary Protections which meet the Trusted Internet Connection (TIC) requirements
row.Remarks: CA-3(3) Guidance: Refer to Appendix H – Cloud Considerations of the TIC 2.0 Reference Architecture document.

row.Title: System Interconnections | Restrictions on External Network Connections
row.Remarks: For JAB Authorization, CSPs shall include details of this control in their Architecture Briefing

row.Title: Plan of Action and Milestones
row.Param_assigns: CA-5b. [at least monthly]
row.Remarks: CA-5 Guidance: Requirement: POA&Ms must be provided at least monthly.

row.Title: Security Authorization
row.Param_assigns: CA-6c. [at least every three years or when a significant change occurs]
row.Remarks: CA-6c. Guidance: Significant change is defined in NIST Special Publication 800-37 Revision 1, Appendix F. The service provider describes the types of changes to the information system or the environment of operations that would impact the risk posture. The types of changes are approved and accepted by the Authorizing Official.

row.Title: Continuous Monitoring
row.Param_assigns: CA-7d. [To meet Federal and FedRAMP requirements]
row.Remarks: Operating System Scans: at least monthly Database and Web Application Scans: at least monthly All scans performed by Independent Assessor: at least annually CA-7 Guidance: CSPs must provide evidence of closure and remediation of high vulnerabilities within the timeframe for standard POA&M updates.

row.Title: Penetration Testing
row.Param_assigns: [at least annually]

row.Title: Penetration Testing | Independent Penetration Agent or Team
Configuration Management Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: CM-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] CM-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Baseline Configuration | Reviews and Updates
row.Param_assigns: CM-2 (1) (a). [at least annually] CM-2 (1) (b). [to include when directed by Authorizing Official]

row.Title: Baseline Configuration | Automation Support For Accuracy / Currency
Baseline Configuration | Retention of Previous Configurations
Baseline Configuration | Configure Systems, Components, or Devices for High-Risk Areas
Configuration Change Control
row.Remarks: Requirement: The service provider establishes a central means of communicating major changes to or developments in the information system or environment of operations that may affect its services to the federal government and associated service consumers (e.g., electronic bulletin board, web status page). The means of communication are approved and accepted by the Authorizing Official. CM-3e Guidance: In accordance with record retention policies and procedures.

row.Title: Access Restrictions For Change | Automated Access Enforcement / Auditing
Access Restrictions For Change | Signed Components
row.Remarks: Guidance: If digital signatures/certificates are unavailable, alternative cryptographic integrity checks (hashes, self-signed certs, etc.) can be utilized.

row.Title: Access Restrictions For Change | Limit Production / Operational Privileges
row.Param_assigns: CM-5 (5) (b). [at least quarterly]

row.Title: Configuration Settings
row.Param_assigns: CM-6a. [See CM-6(a) Additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance]
row.Remarks: CM-6a. Requirement: The service provider shall use the Center for Internet Security guidelines (Level 1) to establish configuration settings or establishes its own configuration settings if USGCB is not available. CM-6a. Requirement: The service provider shall ensure that checklists for configuration settings are Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) validated or SCAP compatible (if validated checklists are not available). CM-6a. Guidance: Information on the USGCB checklists can be found at: http://usgcb.nist.gov/usgcb_faq.html#usgcbfaq_usgcbfdcc .

row.Title: Configuration Settings | Automated Central Management / Application / Verification
Least Functionality
row.Param_assigns: CM-7. [United States Government Configuration Baseline (USGCB)]
row.Remarks: Requirement: The service provider shall use the Center for Internet Security guidelines (Level 1) to establish list of prohibited or restricted functions, ports, protocols, and/or services or establishes its own list of prohibited or restricted functions, ports, protocols, and/or services if USGCB is not available. CM-7. Guidance: Information on the USGCB checklists can be found at: http://usgcb.nist.gov/usgcb_faq.html#usgcbfaq_usgcbfdcc. (Partially derived from AC-17(8).)

row.Title: Least Functionality | Periodic Review
row.Param_assigns: CM-7(1) [ At least Monthly]

row.Title: Least Functionality | Prevent Program Execution
row.Remarks: CM-7(2) Guidance: This control shall be implemented in a technical manner on the information system to only allow programs to run that adhere to the policy (i.e. white listing). This control is not to be based off of strictly written policy on what is allowed or not allowed to run.

row.Title: Least Functionality | Authorized Software / Whitelisting
row.Param_assigns: CM-7(5)[ at least Annually or when there is a change.]

row.Title: Information System Component Inventory
row.Param_assigns: CM-8b. [at least monthly]
row.Remarks: CM-8 Requirement: must be provided at least monthly or when there is a change.

row.Title: Information System Component Inventory | Updates During Installations / Removals
Information System Component Inventory | Automated Unauthorized Component Detection
row.Param_assigns: CM-8 (3) (a). [Continuously, using automated mechanisms with a maximum five-minute delay in detection.]

row.Title: Information System Component Inventory | No Duplicate Accounting of Components
Software Usage Restrictions | Open Source Software
User-Installed Software
row.Param_assigns: CM-11.c. [Continuously (via CM-7 (5))]

row.Title: Contingency Planning Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: CP-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] CP-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Contingency Plan
row.Param_assigns: CP-2d. [at least annually]
row.Remarks: Requirement: For JAB authorizations the contingency lists include designated FedRAMP personnel.

row.Title: Contingency Plan | Coordinate With Related Plans
Contingency Plan | Resume Essential Missions / Business Functions
Contingency Training
row.Param_assigns: CP-3.a. [ 10 days] CP-3.c. [at least annually]

row.Title: Contingency Plan Testing
row.Param_assigns: CP-4a. [at least annually for moderate impact systems; at least every three years for low impact systems] [functional exercises for moderate impact systems; classroom exercises/table top written tests for low impact systems]
row.Remarks: CP-4a. Requirement: The service provider develops test plans in accordance with NIST Special Publication 800-34 (as amended); plans are approved by the Authorizing Official prior to initiating testing.

row.Title: Contingency Plan Testing | Coordinate With Related Plans
Alternate Storage Site | Separation From Primary Site
Alternate Processing Site
row.Remarks: CP-7a. Requirement: The service provider defines a time period consistent with the recovery time objectives and business impact analysis.

row.Title: Alternate Processing Site | Separation From Primary Site
row.Remarks: CP-7(1) Guidance: The service provider may determine what is considered a sufficient degree of separation between the primary and alternate processing sites, based on the types of threats that are of concern. For one particular type of threat (i.e., hostile cyber attack), the degree of separation between sites will be less relevant.

row.Title: Alternate Processing Site | Priority of Service
Telecommunications Services
row.Remarks: CP-8. Requirement: The service provider defines a time period consistent with the business impact analysis.

row.Title: Telecommunications Services | Priority of Service Provisions
Telecommunications Services | Single Points of Failure
Information System Backup
row.Param_assigns: CP-9a. [daily incremental; weekly full] CP-9b. [daily incremental; weekly full] CP-9c. [daily incremental; weekly full]
row.Remarks: CP-9. Requirement: The service provider shall determine what elements of the cloud environment require the Information System Backup control. Requirement: The service provider shall determine how Information System Backup is going to be verified and appropriate periodicity of the check. CP-9a. Requirement: The service provider maintains at least three backup copies of user-level information (at least one of which is available online) or provides an equivalent alternative. CP-9b. Requirement: The service provider maintains at least three backup copies of system-level information (at least one of which is available online) or provides an equivalent alternative. CP-9c. Requirement: The service provider maintains at least three backup copies of information system documentation including security information (at least one of which is available online) or provides an equivalent alternative.

row.Title: Information System Backup | Testing For Reliability / Integrity
row.Param_assigns: CP-9 (1). [at least annually]

row.Title: Information System Backup | Separate Storage for Critical Information
Information System Recovery and Reconstitution | Transaction Recovery
Identification and Authentication Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: IA-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] IA-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) | Network Access to Privileged Accounts
Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) | Network Access to Non-Privileged Accounts
Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) | Local Access to Privileged Accounts
Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) | Group Authentication
Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) | Network Access to Privileged Accounts - Replay Resistant
Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) | Remote Access - Separate Device
row.Param_assigns: The information system implements multifactor authentication for remote access to privileged and non-privileged accounts such that one of the factors is provided by a device separate from the system gaining access and the device meets [Assignment: organization-defined strength of mechanism requirements].

row.Title: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) | Acceptance of PIV Credentials
row.Remarks: Guidance: Include Common Access Card (CAC), i.e., the DoD technical implementation of PIV/FIPS 201/HSPD-12.

row.Title: Identifier Management
row.Param_assigns: IA-4d. [at least two years] IA-4e. [ninety days for user identifiers] (See additional requirements and guidance.)
row.Remarks: IA-4e. Requirement: The service provider defines time period of inactivity for device identifiers.

row.Title: Identifier Management | Identify User Status
row.Param_assigns: IA-4 (4). [contractors; foreign nationals]

row.Title: Authenticator Management
row.Param_assigns: IA-5g. [to include sixty days for passwords]

row.Title: Authenticator Management | Password-Based Authentication
row.Param_assigns: IA-5 (1) (a). [case sensitive, minimum of twelve characters, and at least one each of upper-case letters, lower-case letters, numbers, and special characters] IA-5 (1) (b). [at least one] IA-5 (1) (d). [one day minimum, sixty day maximum] IA-5 (1) (e). [twenty four]

row.Title: Authenticator Management | In-Person or Trusted Third-Party Registration
row.Param_assigns: IA-5 (3). [All hardware/biometric (multifactor authenticators] [in person]

row.Title: Authenticator Management | Automated Support for Password Strength Determination
row.Remarks: IA-4e Additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance: Guidance: If automated mechanisms which enforce password authenticator strength at creation are not used, automated mechanisms must be used to audit strength of created password authenticators

row.Title: Authenticator Management | No Embedded Unencrypted Static Authenticators
Identification and Authentication (Non-Organizational Users) | Acceptance of PIV Credentials from Other Agencies
Identification and Authentication (Non-Organizational Users) | Acceptance of Third-Party Credentials
Identification and Authentication (Non-Organizational Users) | Use of FICAM-Approved Products
Identification and Authentication (Non-Organizational Users) | Use of FICAM-Issued Profiles
Incident Response Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: IR-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] IR-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Incident Response Training
row.Param_assigns: IR-2b. [at least annually]

row.Title: Incident Response Testing
row.Param_assigns: IR-3. [at least annually]
row.Remarks: IR-3. Requirement: The service provider defines tests and/or exercises in accordance with NIST Special Publication 800-61 (as amended). Requirement: For JAB Authorization, the service provider provides test plans to the Authorizing Official (AO) annually. Requirement: Test plans are approved and accepted by the Authorizing Official prior to test commencing.

row.Title: Incident Response Testing | Coordination With Related Plans
Incident Handling
row.Remarks: IR-4/A13. Requirement: The service provider ensures that individuals conducting incident handling meet personnel security requirements commensurate with the criticality/sensitivity of the information being processed, stored, and transmitted by the information system.

row.Title: Incident Handling | Automated Incident Handling Processes
Incident Reporting
row.Param_assigns: IR-6a. [US-CERT incident reporting timelines as specified in NIST Special Publication 800-61 (as amended)]
row.Remarks: Requirement: Reports security incident information according to FedRAMP Incident Communications Procedure.

row.Title: Incident Response Assistance | Automation Support For Availability of Information / Support
Incident Response Assistance | Coordination With External Providers
Incident Response Plan
row.Param_assigns: IR-8c. [at least annually]
row.Remarks: IR-8(b) Additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance: The service provider defines a list of incident response personnel (identified by name and/or by role) and organizational elements. The incident response list includes designated FedRAMP personnel. IR-8(e) Additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance: The service provider defines a list of incident response personnel (identified by name and/or by role) and organizational elements. The incident response list includes designated FedRAMP personnel.

row.Title: Information Spillage Response | Exposure to Unauthorized Personnel
System Maintenance Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: MA-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] MA-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Maintenance Tools | Prevent Unauthorized Removal
row.Param_assigns: MA-3 (3) (d). [the information owner explicitly authorizing removal of the equipment from the facility]

row.Title: Maintenance Personnel | Individuals Without Appropriate Access
row.Remarks: Requirement: Only MA-5 (1)(a)(1) is required by FedRAMP Moderate Baseline

row.Title: Media Protection Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: MP-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] MP-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Media Marking
row.Param_assigns: MP-3b. [no removable media types]
row.Remarks: MP-3b. Guidance: Second parameter not-applicable

row.Title: Media Storage
row.Param_assigns: MP-4a. [all types of digital and non-digital media with sensitive information] within [FedRAMP Assignment: see additional FedRAMP requirements and guidance];
row.Remarks: MP-4a Additional FedRAMP Requirements and Guidance: Requirement: The service provider defines controlled areas within facilities where the information and information system reside.

row.Title: Media Transport
row.Param_assigns: MP-5a. [all media with sensitive information] [prior to leaving secure/controlled environment: for digital media, encryption using a FIPS 140-2 validated encryption module; for non-digital media, secured in locked container]

row.Title: Media Sanitization
row.Param_assigns: The organization: a. Sanitizes [Assignment: organization-defined information system media] prior to disposal, release out of organizational control, or release for reuse using [Assignment: organization-defined sanitization techniques and procedures] in accordance with applicable federal and organizational standards and policies; and b. Employs sanitization mechanisms with the strength and integrity commensurate with the security category or classification of the information.

row.Title: Media Sanitization | Equipment Testing
row.Param_assigns: [At least annually]
row.Remarks: Guidance: Equipment and procedures may be tested or validated for effectiveness

row.Title: Media Use | Prohibit Use without Owner

row.Param_assigns: PE-6b.[at least monthly]

Visitor Access Records

Delivery and Removal
row.Param_assigns: PE-16. [all information system components]

row.Param_assigns: PL-2c. [at least annually]

Rules of Behavior

Information Security Architecture
row.Param_assigns: PL-8b. [At least annually]

row.Title: Personnel Security Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: PS-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] PS-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Position Risk Designation
row.Param_assigns: PS-2c. [at least every three years]

row.Title: Personnel Screening
row.Param_assigns: PS-3b. [for national security clearances; a reinvestigation is required during the 5th year for top secret security clearance, the 10th year for secret security clearance, and 15th year for confidential security clearance. For moderate risk law enforcement and high impact public trust level, a reinvestigation is required during the 5th year. There is no reinvestigation for other moderate risk positions or any low risk positions]

row.Param_assigns: PS-3 (3)(b). [personnel screening criteria – as required by specific information]

row.Param_assigns: PS-4.a. [same day]

row.Title: Personnel Transfer
row.Param_assigns: PS-5. [within five days of the formal transfer action (DoD 24 hours)]

row.Title: Third-Party Personnel Security

row.Title: Risk Assessment Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: RA-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] RA-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Risk Assessment
row.Param_assigns: RA-3b. [security assessment report] RA-3c. [at least every three years or when a significant change occurs] RA-3e. [at least every three years or when a significant change occurs]
row.Remarks: Guidance: Significant change is defined in NIST Special Publication 800-37 Revision 1, Appendix F. RA-3d. Requirement: to include the Authorizing Official; for JAB authorizations to include FedRAMP

row.Title: Vulnerability Scanning
row.Param_assigns: RA-5a. [monthly operating system/infrastructure; monthly web applications and databases] RA-5d. [high-risk vulnerabilities mitigated within thirty days from date of discovery; moderate-risk vulnerabilities mitigated within ninety days from date of discovery]
row.Remarks: RA-5a. Requirement: an accredited independent assessor scans operating systems/infrastructure, web applications, and databases once annually. RA-5e. Requirement: to include the Risk Executive; for JAB authorizations to include FedRAMP

row.Title: Vulnerability Scanning | Update by Frequency / Prior to New Scan / When Identified
row.Param_assigns: RA-5 (2). [prior to a new scan]

row.Title: Vulnerability Scanning | Breadth / Depth of Coverage
Vulnerability Scanning | Privileged Access
row.Param_assigns: RA-5 (5). [operating systems / web applications / databases] [all scans]

row.Title: Vulnerability Scanning | Automated Trend Analyses
row.Remarks: RA-5(6) Guidance: include in Continuous Monitoring ISSO digest/report to Authorizing Official

row.Title: Vulnerability Scanning | Review Historic Audit Logs
row.Remarks: RA-5 (8). Requirements: This enhancement is required for all high vulnerability scan findings. Guidance: While scanning tools may lable findings as high or critical, the intent of the control is based around NIST's definition of high vulnerability.

row.Title: System and Services Acquisition Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: SA-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] SA-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Acquisition Process
row.Remarks: SA-4. Guidance: The use of Common Criteria (ISO/IEC 15408) evaluated products is strongly preferred. See http://www.niap-ccevs.org/vpl or http://www.commoncriteriaportal.org/products.html.

row.Title: Acquisition Process | Functional Properties of Security Controls
Acquisition Process | Design / Implementation Information for Security Controls
row.Param_assigns: [to include security-relevant external system interfaces and high-level design]

row.Title: Acquisition Process | Continuous Monitoring Plan
row.Param_assigns: SA-4 (8). [at least the minimum requirement as defined in control CA-7]
row.Remarks: SA-4 (8) Guidance: CSP must use the same security standards regardless of where the system component or information system service is aquired.

row.Title: Acquisition Process | Functions / Ports / Protocols / Services in Use
Acquisition Process | Use of Approved PIV Products
External Information System Services
row.Param_assigns: SA-9a. [FedRAMP Security Controls Baseline(s) if Federal information is processed or stored within the external system] SA-9c. [Federal/FedRAMP Continuous Monitoring requirements must be met for external systems where Federal information is processed or stored]

row.Title: External Information Systems | Risk Assessments / Organizational Approvals
row.Param_assigns: SA-9 (1) see Additional Requirement and Guidance
row.Remarks: SA-9 (1). Requirement: The service provider documents all existing outsourced security services and conducts a risk assessment of future outsourced security services. For JAB authorizations, future planned outsourced services are approved and accepted by the JAB.

row.Title: External Information Systems | Identification of Functions / Ports / Protocols / Services
row.Param_assigns: SA-9 (2). [All external systems where Federal information is processed, transmitted or stored]

row.Title: External Information Systems | Consistent Interests of Consumers and Providers
row.Param_assigns: SA-9 (4). [All external systems where Federal information is processed, transmitted or stored]

row.Title: External Information Systems | Processing, Storage, and Service Location
row.Param_assigns: SA-9 (5). [information processing, transmission, information data, AND information services]

row.Title: Developer Configuration Management
row.Param_assigns: SA-10a. [development, implementation, AND operation]
row.Remarks: SA-10e. Requirement: for JAB authorizations, track security flaws and flaw resolution within the system, component, or service and report findings to organization-defined personnel, to include FedRAMP.

row.Title: Developer Configuration Management | Software / Firmware Integrity Verification
Developer Security Testing and Evaluation | Static Code Analysis
row.Remarks: Requirement: SA-11 (1) or SA-11 (8) or both Requirement: The service provider documents in the Continuous Monitoring Plan, how newly developed code for the information system is reviewed.

row.Title: Developer Security Testing and Evaluation | Threat and Vulnerability Analyses
Developer Security Testing and Evaluation | Dynamic Code Analysis
row.Remarks: Requirement: SA-11 (1) or SA-11 (8) or both Requirement: The service provider documents in the Continuous Monitoring Plan, how newly developed code for the information system is reviewed.

row.Title: System and Communications Protection Policy and Procedures
row.Param_assigns: SC-1.b.1 [at least every 3 years] SC-1.b.2 [at least annually]

row.Title: Boundary Protection | External Telecommunications Services
row.Param_assigns: SC-7 (4). [at least annually]

row.Title: Boundary Protection | Deny by Default / Allow by Exception
Boundary Protection | Prevent Split Tunneling for Remote Devices
Boundary Protection | Route Traffic to Authenticated Proxy Servers
Boundary Protection | Isolation of Security Tools / Mechanisms / Support Components
row.Remarks: SC-7 (13). Requirement: The service provider defines key information security tools, mechanisms, and support components associated with system and security administration and isolates those tools, mechanisms, and support components from other internal information system components via physically or logically separate subnets.

row.Title: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity
row.Param_assigns: SC-8. [confidentiality AND integrity]

row.Title: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity | Cryptographic or Alternate Physical Protection
row.Param_assigns: SC-8 (1). [prevent unauthorized disclosure of information AND detect changes to information] [a hardened or alarmed carrier Protective Distribution System (PDS)]

row.Title: Network Disconnect
row.Param_assigns: SC-10. [no longer than 30 minutes for RAS-based sessions or no longer than 60 minutes for non-interactive user sessions]

row.Title: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management
row.Remarks: SC-12 Guidance: Federally approved cryptography

row.Title: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management | Symmetric Keys
row.Param_assigns: SC-12 (2). [NIST FIPS-compliant]

row.Title: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management | Asymmetric Keys
Cryptographic Protection
row.Param_assigns: [FIPS-validated or NSA-approved cryptography]

row.Title: Collaborative Computing Devices
row.Param_assigns: SC-15a. [no exceptions]

row.Title: Secure Name / Address Resolution Service (Authoritative Source)
Secure Name / Address Resolution Service (Recursive or Caching Resolver)
Architecture and Provisioning for Name / Address Resolution Service
Protection of Information At Rest
row.Param_assigns: SC-28. [confidentiality AND integrity]
row.Remarks: SC-28. Guidance: The organization supports the capability to use cryptographic mechanisms to protect information at rest.

row.Title: Protection Of Information At Rest | Cryptographic Protection
System and Information Integrity Policy and Procedures

row.Title: Flaw Remediation | Time to Remediate Flaws / Benchmarks for Corrective Actions
Malicious Code Protection

Information System Monitoring | Automated Tools For Real-Time Analysis
Information System Monitoring | Inbound and Outbound Communications Traffic

Information System Monitoring | Correlate Monitoring Information
Security Alerts, Advisories, and Directives
